item.title: Israel to open more aid routes to Gaza and increase deliveries after pressure from Biden
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Shabad and Carol E. Lee and Peter Alexander and Monica Alba and Allie Raffa and Courtney Kube and Yuliya Talmazan and Yamiche Alcindor and Frank Thorp V and Alexandra Bacallao and Zoë Richards and Rebecca Kaplan
item.description: Israel committed to taking new steps that would boost the flow of aid into Gaza after a call between President Joe Biden and Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu on Thursday.

media:content.media:text: President Joe Biden
media:content.media:description: President Joe Biden on Oct. 18, 2023, in Tel Aviv.

media:content.media:text: oval office white house desk telephone
media:content.media:description: President Joe Biden speaks with Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu via telephone from the Oval Office of the White House, on Thursday.

item.title: Class destroyed: A look at what has become of Gaza's revered universities
item.dc:creator: Chantal Da Silva and Yasmine Salam and Matthew Mulligan and Bianca Britton
item.description: Built over decades, Gaza’s universities embodied the ambitions of young Palestinians. In weeks, the Israeli military destroyed them.

item.title: Sean 'Diddy' Combs' son accused of sex assault in lawsuit that also names music mogul as defendant
item.dc:creator: Diana Dasrath and Doha Madani
item.description: LOS ANGELES — Sean “Diddy” Combs, who is a subject of a federal sex trafficking investigation, has been named as a defendant in a new lawsuit that alleges his son sexually assaulted a woman while she was working on a yacht the music mogul had chartered for a trip at the end of 2022.

media:content.media:text: puff daddy diddy sean
media:content.media:description: Sean "Diddy" Combs and Christian Combs in Las Vegas, in 2022.

media:content.media:text: Federal agents walk at the entrance to a property belonging to Sean "Diddy" Combs
media:content.media:description: Federal agents walk at the entrance to a property belonging to Sean "Diddy" Combs on March 25, 2024 in Miami Beach, Fla.

item.title: Judge denies Trump bid to dismiss classified documents case using Presidential Records Act
item.dc:creator: Katherine Doyle and Daniel Barnes and Dareh Gregorian and Zoë Richards and Megan Lebowitz and Summer Concepcion
item.description: A judge Thursday denied former President Donald Trump's bid to dismiss a case alleging he mishandled classified documents, rejecting his argument that the papers were considered personal under the Presidential Records Act.

media:content.media:text: Donald Trump
media:content.media:description: Donald Trump on April 2, 2024 in Grand Rapids, Mich.

item.title: DOJ takes action after Mississippi coroner buried men without families’ knowledge
item.dc:creator: Jon Schuppe
item.description: The Department of Justice will help authorities in Hinds County, Mississippi, improve death notification procedures, after NBC News reported on wrongful burials.

media:content.media:text: Image: Pauper's field Potter's field in Mississippi
media:content.media:description: The pauper's field where the Hinds County coroner's office buried men whose families were searching for them.

media:content.media:text: Clockwise from top left, David Shane Kelly, Micheal Akeem Williams, Marrio Moore, Jonathan David Hankins, James Aaron Moran, Dexter Wade and Mark Nelson Bushnell.
media:content.media:description: Clockwise from top left, David Shane Kelly, Micheal Akeem Williams, Marrio Moore, Jonathan David Hankins, James Aaron Moran, Dexter Wade and Mark Nelson Bushnell. All were buried in the pauper's field without their families' knowing.

media:content.media:text: Image: Bettersten Wade is comforted by her sister.
media:content.media:description: Bettersten Wade finally found her son's grave months after he went missing.

item.title: Alabama murderer gives up appeals and asks to be executed so that victims’ families have ‘justice’
item.dc:creator: Abigail Brooks and Corky Siemaszko
item.description: A convicted killer on death row in Alabama told NBC News he no longer wants to delay justice for the families of the five people he murdered eight years ago and is ready to pay the ultimate price for his crimes.

media:content.media:credit: Greene County Sheriff's Department via AP
media:content.media:text: Derrick Dearman
media:content.media:description: Derrick Dearman.

media:content.media:text: From left: Murder victims Chelsea Marie Reed, who was five months pregnant; Shannon Melissa Randall; Robert Lee Brown; Justin Kaleb Reed; and Joseph Adam.
media:content.media:description: From left: Murder victims Chelsea Marie Reed, who was five months pregnant; Shannon Melissa Randall; Robert Lee Brown; Justin Kaleb Reed; and Joseph Adam Turner.

item.title: Stronger marijuana linked to more psychosis in teens
item.description: As legal cannabis becomes more available, doctors have noticed that more teens are suffering from psychotic events that they attribute to the increased potency of the drug. NBC News' Kate Snow reports.

media:content.media:title: Stronger marijuana linked to more psychosis in teens
media:content.media:description: As legal cannabis becomes more available, doctors have noticed that more teens are suffering from psychotic events that they attribute to the increased potency of the drug. NBC News' Kate Snow reports.

item.title: Your last-minute guide to Monday's total solar eclipse
item.dc:creator: Denise Chow and Lucas Thompson
item.description: A total solar eclipse will cross North America on Monday, offering millions a rare opportunity to see afternoon skies darken as the moon blocks the sun.

media:content.media:text: Photo Illustration: The phases of a total solar eclipse
Photo Illustration: The phases of a total solar eclipse
This composite image of thirteen photographs shows the progression of a total solar eclipse
media:content.media:description: This composite image of 13 photographs shows the progression of a total solar eclipse, from right to left, at Madras High School in Madras, Ore., on Aug. 21, 2017.

media:content.media:text: Image: Tyler Hanson
media:content.media:description: Tyler Hanson, of Fort Rucker, Alabama, watches the sun moments before the total eclipse on Aug. 21, 2017, in Nashville, Tenn.

media:content.media:text: The "diamond ring effect" is shown following totality of the solar eclipse at Palm Cove in Australia's Tropical North Queensland in 2012.
media:content.media:description: The "diamond ring effect" is shown following totality of the solar eclipse at Palm Cove in Australia's Tropical North Queensland in 2012.

media:content.media:text: The Bailey's Beads effect is seen as the moon makes its final move over the sun during the total solar eclipse on Monday, August 21, 2017 above Madras, Oregon.
media:content.media:description: The Baily's beads effect is seen as the moon makes its final move over the sun during the total solar eclipse on Aug. 21, 2017, above Madras, Ore.

item.title: 'Freaked out' Democrats mobilize to stop RFK Jr. from cutting into Biden
item.dc:creator: Carol E. Lee and Alex Seitz-Wald and Vaughn Hillyard
item.description: Democrats have adopted a radically different strategy on independent candidates in 2024, waging an expensive open war on the likes of Robert F. Kennedy Jr.

media:content.media:text: Robert F. Kennedy Jr. attends a Cesar Chavez Day event at Union Station on March 30, 2024 in Los Angeles
media:content.media:description: Robert F. Kennedy Jr.

item.title: South Carolina resort sued for 4-year-old’s drowning, the third death of a child there in three years
item.dc:creator: Elizabeth Chuck
item.description: A trip to Crown Reef Beach Resort and Waterpark in Myrtle Beach, South Carolina, turned to horror when 4-year-old Demi Williams drowned in one of the resort’s pools, which had no lifeguards attending to it and was poorly lit, according to a lawsuit filed last week.

media:content.media:text: Crown Reef Beach Resort and Waterpark.
media:content.media:description: Crown Reef Beach Resort and Waterpark.

media:content.media:text: 4-year-old Demi Williams.
media:content.media:description: Demi Williams.

media:content.media:credit: Universal Images Group via Getty Images
media:content.media:text: Crown Reef resort Myrtle Beach
media:content.media:description: Crown Reef resort and hotel.

item.title: Amid racist insults, ‘Bachelor’ contestant Rachel Nance won’t apologize for her culture
item.dc:creator: Kimmy Yam
item.description: Despite being called racist slurs by fans of ABC's "The Bachelor," contestant Rachel Nance, who’s Asian and Black, says she refuses to dilute any aspect of her heritage.

media:content.media:text: Rachel Nance on "The Bachelor" on March 18, 2024.
media:content.media:description: Rachel Nance, whose mother is Filipino and father Black and Arab, was among the top three contestants of the last season.

media:content.media:text: Rachel Nance and Joey Graziadei
media:content.media:description: Nance was criticized for the interracial nature of her relationship with Bachelor Joey Graziadei.

item.title: Desperate search for trapped earthquake victims in Taiwan
item.description: With at least 10 dead from the powerful quake, the search intensified for dozens of people who are missing and may be trapped in the rubble. NBC News' Janis Mackey Frayer reports.

media:content.media:title: Desperate search for trapped earthquake victims in Taiwan
media:content.media:description: With at least 10 dead from the powerful quake, the search intensified for dozens of people who are missing and may be trapped in the rubble. NBC News' Janis Mackey Frayer reports.

item.title: DATELINE FRIDAY SNEAK PEEK: The Night Time Stopped
item.description: Keith Morrison reports new revelations in the headline-making case of murdered professional cyclist Moriah Wilson, including fresh courtroom evidence and a police interview with a key witness. Airs Friday, April 5 at 9/8c on NBC.

media:content.media:title: DATELINE FRIDAY SNEAK PEEK: The Night Time Stopped
media:content.media:description: Keith Morrison reports new revelations in the headline-making case of murdered professional cyclist Moriah Wilson, including fresh courtroom evidence and a police interview with a key witness. Airs Friday, April 5 at 9/8c on NBC.

item.title: 1 killed, 2 hospitalized after crane section falls from a Florida high-rise
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press
item.description: One person was killed and two others were hospitalized Thursday afternoon when a section of crane fell from a building in downtown Fort Lauderdale, officials said.

media:content.media:text: A construction worker was killed and two people were taken to the hospital after a portion of a crane dropped onto the Southeast Third Avenue bridge over the New River in downtown Fort Lauderdale, Fla., Thursday, April 4, 2024.
media:content.media:description: A construction worker was killed and two people were taken to the hospital after a portion of a crane dropped onto the Southeast Third Avenue bridge over the New River in downtown Fort Lauderdale, Fla., Thursday, April 4, 2024.

item.title: Yellen kicks off China meetings with overcapacity concerns
item.dc:creator: Evelyn Cheng, CNBC
item.description: Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen kicked off her first full day of official meetings in China discussing overcapacity concerns and market-oriented reforms.

media:content.media:text: Image: *** BESTPIX *** CHINA-US-DIPLOMACY
media:content.media:description: Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen, left, with Chinese Vice Minister of Finance Liao Min and U.S. Ambassador to China Nicholas Burns in Guangzhou, China, on Thursday.

item.title: N.Y. AG seeks more information about Trump bond, collateral
item.dc:creator: Lisa Rubin and Adam Reiss and Megan Lebowitz
item.description: WASHINGTON — New York Attorney General Letitia James filed a notice on Thursday seeking more information about former President Donald Trump's bond for the civil fraud case, which was issued by Knight Specialty Insurance Company.

media:content.media:text: law legal trump civil trial
media:content.media:description: New York Attorney General Letitia James during a press briefing in New York, on Feb. 16.

item.title: Congressional primary tie in California points to three-way race in November
item.dc:creator: Megan Lebowitz
item.description: Evan Low and Joe Simitian are tied for second place. The top two finishers in California advance to the general election, but a tie could allow for all three.

media:content.media:text: vote ballot processing
media:content.media:description: Ballots are inspected at a ballot processing center, in the City of Industry, Calif., on March 5.

media:content.media:text: politics political politician
media:content.media:description: Democratic Assemblyman Evan Low at the Capitol in Sacramento, Calif., in 2023.

media:content.media:text: politics political politician
media:content.media:description: Then-State Sen. Joe Simitian, D-Palo Alto, at the Capitol in Sacramento, Calif., in 2012.

item.title: Inmates at New York prison will get to watch eclipse after all
item.dc:creator: Phil Helsel and Erin McLaughlin
item.description: Inmates at New York state’s Woodbourne Correctional Facility will get to view Monday’s solar eclipse after all, lawyers for the inmates who sued over the matter said Thursday.

media:content.media:text: Warby Parker Offers Free Eclipse Glasses Ahead Of The Celestial Event On April 8
media:content.media:description: Inmates at New York state’s Woodbourne Correctional Facility will be able to go outside to see Monday's eclipse after six sued.

media:content.media:text: Woodbourne Correctional Facility in Sullivan County, N.Y., on Jan. 30, 2001.
media:content.media:description: Woodbourne Correctional Facility in Sullivan County, N.Y., in 2001.

item.title: Trump official Jeffrey Clark likely violated ethics rules with 2020 election theories, D.C. Bar panel finds
item.dc:creator: Daniel Barnes and Ryan J. Reilly
item.description: A disciplinary panel reached a preliminary conclusion that former Trump Justice Department official Jeffrey Clark committed an ethical violation as it considers his bar status.

media:content.media:text: Image: Congressman Matt Gaetz Hosts D.C. Field Hearing On January 6th
media:content.media:description: Jeffrey Clark, former Acting Assistant Attorney General on June 13, 2023 in Washington.

item.title: New York can take legal action against county’s ban on female trans athletes, judge says
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press
item.description: New York state officials may continue to take legal action against a county outside New York City that has banned transgender players from women’s and girls teams, a judge has ruled.

media:content.media:text: Letitia James
media:content.media:description: New York Attorney General Letitia James on Feb. 16 in New York.

item.title: How Michigan’s key union voters are making up their minds: From the Politics Desk
item.dc:creator: The Politics Desk
item.description: Michigan union voters explain why they are backing Biden or Trump in the 2024 presidential election. No Labels ends its bipartisan ticket.
